sentence: Sen. Michelle Ugenti-Rita, R-Scottsdale, who introduced the bill and worked on it with Ducey's support, said that passing it was imperative, given that it was impossible to predict who could become governor next.
author: Gloria Gomez
title: Bill to limit Arizona governor's emergency powers was sparked by Ducey's COVID orders

sentence: The progressive initiative announced Tuesday aims to go around the Legislature, which is elected by the people to represent their interests, said Sen. Michelle Ugenti-Rita, a Scottsdale Republican and a leading sponsor of GOP election bills.
author: ASSOCIATED PRESS
title: Sweeping Arizona ballot initiative aims to protect voting rights

sentence: Republican U.S. Senate candidate Jim Lamon and GOP Secretary of State hopeful Michelle Ugenti-Rita will address the Conservative Republican Club of Kingman at 11 a.m. on Monday, Feb. 14.
title: Lamon, Ugenti-Rita to speak to Conservative Republican Club of Kingman

sentence: He noted that Republican state Sen. Michelle Ugenti-Rita called teachers “educational terrorists" and Republican gubernatorial candidate Matt Salmon said they are "a scourge on our society."
author: Bob Brigham
title: Arizona Republicans call teachers ‘educational terrorists’ and ‘a scourge on our society’: report

sentence: Paul Boyer of Glendale and Michelle Ugenti-Rita of Scottsdale.
title: Arizona Senate Votes Down Bill to Audit Every Election

sentence: Sen. Paul Boyer, R-Glendale, is joining with Democrats (and on occasion, Sen. Michelle Ugenti-Rita, R-Scottsdale) to vote no on a raft of election bills — by my count at least six this week alone.
author: Laurie Roberts
title: Enough with the election bills. When will our leaders fix problems that actually exist?

sentence: Sen. Michelle Ugenti-Rita, R-Scottsdale, has advocated for the legislature to restore PC elections in a special session as a workaround for the lack of Democratic votes.
author: Jeremy Duda
title: Counties: retroactivity clause won’t put party activists back on Arizona ballot
